gameDescription: In a world where illegal wildlife trade wreaks havoc, Greater Good Charities and Wildlife At Risk come together to save the world's most heavily poached and trafficked mammal - the pangolin. Cast as intelligent airships from two elite squadrons, players are tasked with a trailblazing eco-mission: to safely and efficiently transport rescued pangolins over a vast expanse from Africa to a newly constructed enclosure in Vietnam. Every strategic decision players make during this rescue odyssey encapsulates weighty dilemmas - priorities of time, mission safety, resource conservation, and impacts on environment and wildlife.

blueTeam.name: Preservation Pioneers
blueTeam.description: Known for their strategic navigation and adept crisis management.

redTeam.name: Conservation Crusaders
redTeam.description: Renowned for their resilience, high-speed transportation, and efficiency.

turns.scenario: Having rescued the pangolins from poachers, the airships face immediate challenges. Local authorities are delayed in issuing the necessary transportation approvals. The precious time lost can stress the pangolins.

options.A: Wait for the official approval risking the pangolins' health.
options.B: Initiate the journey without official approval, risking penalties.

AA.narrative: Both teams decide to wait. The pangolins are stressed, delaying their recovery, but no international laws are compromised in the process.

AB.narrative: Preservation Pioneers wait while Conservation Crusaders start the journey. The latter save time but are fined heavily, straining the next phase in rescuing these endangered species.

BA.narrative: Conservation Crusaders wait while Preservation Pioneers take to the skies. This move saves the latter time but their hasty decision ends up violating international wildlife transportation laws.

BB.narrative: Both teams forgo the approval. They do save time and reduce stress on the pangolins, but both face hefty fines and international scrutiny.

turns.scenario: The airships are in distress due to violent thunderstorms. Prolonged exposure to the storm may distress the pangolins and harm the airships.

options.A: Attempt to fly through the storm using advanced guidance systems.
options.B: Detour around the storm, consuming more fuel but ensuring the pangolins' safety.

AA.narrative: Both teams choose to brave the storm. Their advanced systems help navigate safely but the jostling does distress the pangolins.

AB.narrative: The Preservation Pioneers take on the storm while the Conservation Crusaders take a safer route. The clever detour means higher fuel consumption, but their pangolins are calmer.

BA.narrative: The brave Conservation Crusaders face the storm, while the Preservation Pioneers opt for a safer detour. Despite severe jostling,the Crusaders manage a faster trip.

BB.narrative: Both teams take the safer, albeit longer route, trading extra fuel consumption for pangolin comfort and safety. Their mutual decision exemplifies their commitment to the mission.

turns.scenario: As the airships near Vietnam, they encounter a massive human protest. Flying over these crowds is a faster route but may spark public outcry and endanger the mission.

options.A: Negotiate a peaceful flyover with protesters.
options.B: Choose an alternate route, with increased flight time and fuel use, to avoid any potential conflict.

AA.narrative: Both teams attempt negotiation. Successfully convincing the crowd, the airships pass smoothly with the protesters cheering them on, a proud moment for pangolin conservation.

AB.narrative: The Preservation Pioneers negotiate successfully while the Conservation Crusaders choose to avoid confrontation. The former arrive slightly ahead, becoming heroes amidst the crowd.

BA.narrative: The Conservation Crusaders negotiate a flyover while the Preservation Pioneers stick to an alternate route. The Crusaders manage to speed through, catalyzing public support for the mission.

BB.narrative: Both teams opt for an alternate route. Despite using extra fuel, their tactical decision mitigates potential altercations, focusing on the well-being of the pangolins and the overall mission success.
